website_summaries.verdict: Its pricier counterparts perform better, but it's hard to argue with this unit's generally consistent performance for the low price.
pros: A budget-friendly appliance – ideal for making everything from noodles to hot beverages
cons: Numerous customers complain about faulty temperature controls

customer_reviews.title: New Cover Design is Horrible
customer_reviews.text: So.... I burned my hand just trying to remove the lid because I had cauliflower in there. My old one (another brand from Walgreens) worked perfectly for 5 years before dying....R.I.P my love. This cover cannot be easily opened with one finger like a regular kettle pot, you have to put some elbow grease and pull where you can see that shadow part on the lid. Very stupid design. It works like it should in terms of boiling water fast. Too bad I threw away the packaging otherwise this thing was going back right where it came from for giving me a second-degree burn on my arm!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Steam burns
customer_reviews.text: Lid does not move on a hinge and must be removed by applying a lot of force straight up with the handle on top. There is NO way to do this without getting burned by steam when the pot is operating and leaving the lid on means the strainer causes horribly inaccurate and messy pours.
customer_reviews.author: Just another quilter

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design, Takes Ages to Clean
customer_reviews.text: I got this to heat up some soup while camping using my car's outlet, but this was just terrible to use. This hot pot works functionally to boil water or to cook some noodles/soup in, but it is much to difficult to clean to be of much utility. There are so many crevices that take ages to clean, that it's actually just faster to use a pot than this. Its unbeatable price is the only redeeming factor of this hot pot, but realistically, the time spent in having to clean it really doesn't make it worthwhile. I would purchase something else if you can spend a little more.
customer_reviews.author: James Berlin

customer_reviews.title: The levels don't seem to work for anything other than boil
customer_reviews.text: While this does work to boil water....it seems to only work at boiling water. While there is a dial with different levels...none of them reduce the water temp below boiling. I bought this months ago and still use it...but only as a water boiling device. Just not nuanced enough to do anything but boil water.
customer_reviews.author: Breezer

customer_reviews.title: Works, with one flaw
customer_reviews.text: I use this simply to boil water for ramen, instant coffee drinks, and hit chocolate. I’ve also used it while doing dishes. I had a particularly awful pan that I knew needed to soak in very hot water. In a minute, I had it to a half boil when it was half full. Poured it in my soapy pan and yes, it helped immensely. It works exactly as I expected. I’m taking a star off though because I literally have to pry the lid off with the tips of my fingers every single time. Maybe it’s warped, idk.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy70

customer_reviews.title: HAZARDOUS-steam burn; other problems too
customer_reviews.text: The design of this kettle is flawed. When the water is very hot, holding the handle exposes your hand to steam escaping from vents that are--absurdly and dangerously--right at the level that your thumb is. I got burned and you may too. Two other problems: no indicator light to show it is working (you have to listen) and the lid is hard to remove. I can't imagine how it has such good ratings. Returned of course.
customer_reviews.author: kathy

customer_reviews.title: Good value hotpot
customer_reviews.text: This pot was terrific for a trip where we could not get hot water easily in the morning. It heats quickly and was easy to clean. The biggest issue was it does not turn off once it starts boiling, as mentioned by other reviewers. You can turn the control to warm, and it will keep the water still in the pot warm, but you need to go to it and do that each time you boil the water. The top is also a little hard to take off. It still met our expectations, and was a good value for what we spent on it.
customer_reviews.author: DL Mom

customer_reviews.title: It heats up freaking fast - like faster than a microwave
customer_reviews.text: My boss is too cheap to buy a microwave, so I leave this at work to make a quick can of soup. It heats up freaking fast - like faster than a microwave! I had read that before purchasing and didn't believe that until I tried it. Cleans up super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Hisfirstwife

customer_reviews.title: What's with the film?
customer_reviews.text: What I don't like is the starchy looking white film left in the pot, after boiling plain water for beverages. This makes me have to clean it after each use, or it turns up In my next cup when I turn water on again. Also a waste of water if I do not use all if the water I boil in one sitting. Otherwise just what I need to avoid going into kitchen at night.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. AKASHA

customer_reviews.title: I will never by a proctor silex product again now that I know they are willing to sell such unsafe garbage.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is going to burn someones house down. It does not have a shut-off, it boils indefinitely. This dial on the front must be a rheostat rather than a thermostat wired to kick open the power switch(like on a normal kettle). It has no on/off switch. Unsafe. I will never by a proctor silex product again now that I know they are willing to sell such unsafe garbage.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This had similar ratings to other hot pots that were more expensive so I figured it wouldn’t do any harm to go cheaper but it is certainly noticeable with this product. The metal plate on the bottom doesn’t heat to a steady temperature but turns on and off at different intervals based on how hot you want it. The plate also burns food on the bottom and doesn’t cook food on the top. If you were hoping for something easy to clean, look elsewhere, this pot bakes the contents onto the bottom plate making it extremely difficult to clean. Overall the hot pot doesn’t work very well and certainly isn’t worth more than a couple bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy. Bad kettle.
customer_reviews.text: Bad purchase. This thing only has ONE temperature. BOILING! Even at the lowest setting, water is practically boiling. You can really only use this to boil water quickly. Everything else, on lowest setting literally plug it in for a few seconds and it’s bubbling up,unplug to stir, repeat. It’s stupid. A really bad product.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: good for those with limited hand Mobility
customer_reviews.text: recently had a stroke, and Miss which water is just the right weight for me to handle. It heat very rapidly, and I can use the extra hot water to wash my dishes. Thank you for such a great product.
customer_reviews.author: luvoshan

customer_reviews.title: Not safe
customer_reviews.text: The power cord is just a little over a foot long. Way too on short. There is no on/off switch, just a know to control the heat, from warm to boil. Even if left on for a short time, the water quickly evaporates & the unit become very hot. It doesn't automatically shut off. While it quickly heats water (never tried anything else), the short cord, the lack of an on/off control, & the difficulty removing the lid make this product unsafe for the elderly or handicapped. Children should not use this. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great - just what I wanted for a trip w/grandsons
customer_reviews.text: great - just what I wanted for a trip w/grandsons. Made oatmeal, coffee, tea & cocoa - plus plenty of Ramen.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia L Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Quick to boil
customer_reviews.text: We pretty much only use this to boil water, so we don't really change the temp control much. It boils water significantly faster than my teapot on the stovetop, so faster tea and ramen. I don't know if I'd want to cook anything tomato based in it, as it likely would stain the plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Good price for what you get
customer_reviews.text: I'm a college student and for the most part it worked perfectly. Easy to use, easy to wash, and easy to put away. I have only had it for one year but it has held up. The dark blue is a pretty color but it was difficult to see if the water was boiling. The only real downside, though is that the cover is somewhat tricky to take off and when there's hot soup or hot water in there you have to be careful to be forceful enough to get the cover off but gentle enough to not spill everything on you.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! It will bring water to boil in about 1 minute easy if you set it on high. I use it in my horse trailer living quarters when camping. Great for oatmeal! Or, if you just want to warm some water to put in sink and wash face. I bring water to boil and pour in sink with cold water. Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Ncreiner

customer_reviews.title: Be cautious with this item, it gets hot with a quickness!
customer_reviews.text: The lid/cover/top of the one I received is very difficult to remove, to take off in order to add ? what it is a person wants to heat, or cook. The vent holes in the cover back by the handle allows steam to exit, this can be a problem when heating water and it starts boiling. Keep your hand(s) down by side of the pot, OH! , the the pot gets hot too. Then, there's water ( or ? ) spilling when you go pouring out hot liquid stuff. I'll have to shop more when this one burns out, don't know that I'd buy another Procter Silex like this one. Still,this one does what it suppose to do.
customer_reviews.author: * live-on *

customer_reviews.title: Poor cover
customer_reviews.text: This pot great for oatmeal and noodle. It heats so quickly and light weight too. But the lid too tight and difficult to open it. So I don't put it on all the way since afraid of burning my finger. Overall I give three star.If seller can do something on lid ,will love give five star
customer_reviews.author: claudia GOMEZ

customer_reviews.title: It gets things boiling even on low I wouldn't leave it unattended.
customer_reviews.text: I love this portable liquid heater for getting the water real hot for hot chocolate, & hot cider quick. Especially when big pots take forever to heat & if you have a group now with no prep time this is quick just keep adding liquid. I know another person with this item who cooks eggs scrambled in microwave because of busy life I told them to try cooking them in the proctor I know they would have better texture & taste better with the same cooking time.
customer_reviews.author: 1ranchita

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes easy to clean, but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: If your just using this for liquids it's fantastic. I've done chunky soups and after pouring those out the plastic stains really easy.
customer_reviews.author: ILLaC

customer_reviews.title: love this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. Every morning I boil water for my tea and in less than 2 minutes the water is boiling, I even boil my eggs, and 5 minutes after the perfect eggs are ready I haven't tried making a soup yet because my main purpose was hot water for my tea. this product is a GAME changer.
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes Acosta

customer_reviews.title: I like this because I don't like using the microwave because ...
customer_reviews.text: I like this because I don't like using the microwave because it kills the food. OMG, it heats in minutes. I usually make my tea first and then use the excess water to make my oatmeal. What I didn't like was that after washing it a few times the non-stick plate at the bottom became scorched; that speaks to how hot this little bowl gets. For lunch, I just add a little water at the bottom and add my meal, its also great for soups. Nonetheless, I will always have one!
customer_reviews.author: Susan C

customer_reviews.title: It works fine
customer_reviews.text: It works fine for it's purpose. I used it for dipping synthetic braids into. It isn't real deep, but was able to get all of the braids in. It would not work for dipping too many braids at a time, maybe about 10 medium size ones.
customer_reviews.author: Al Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to do, durable and inexpensive option
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in a hardware store years ago and it worked great. Lent it to a friend and let them keep it since they really needed it. They even use it for a double boiler by placing a glass measuring cup inside while boiling. This one we purchased from Amazon is the same product and works just as well. Haven't used ours for anything except boiling water for tea or coffee in our RV (haven't used it boon docking yet). Easy to clean, we only use filtered water in it though. Boils fast, within 5 minutes at middle setting. Would set it higher but don't really need it faster than that. Unplug to turn off.
customer_reviews.author: A. M.

customer_reviews.title: This product needs an on/off switch.
customer_reviews.text: Gave this away - it didn't make sense to return considering the return shipping cost. If this product is plugged in, it is on. Would have preferred an on/off switch, automatic shutoff after 1 hour or something to avoid burning food or burning out the heating element.
customer_reviews.author: Sunseeker

customer_reviews.title: Temp control doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Pot is set to boil no matter what the temp control says. Does not "simmer" anything. Full on hard boil or nothing. It's still usable if you want to boil water quickly, but the low setting simply doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Velox Mortis

customer_reviews.title: Hot Liquid can splatter as you struggle to remove Lid  !
customer_reviews.text: the main issue is that it is unsafe to use unless you leave the Lid OFF . the design does not allow you to easily and safely remove it ........so you could easily splatter hot liquid as you struggle to get it off . Please be careful.........and consider using it without the lid , for added safety. the pot does boil water quickly and is easy to clean .
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Very fast, very reliable way to heat water. Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I use this every morning to rapidly heat the water for my instant coffee. And I do mean rapidly. Love it. Getting another for a back-up, just in case. Have given some to friends as well.
customer_reviews.author: GenaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: No temp control
customer_reviews.text: This product is advertised as temperature control. It IS NOT temp control. It just switched on and off of high temp. So for instance on low setting it burns the heck out of your food for about 15 seconds then turns off for 15 seconds. You get what you pay for I guess.
customer_reviews.author: PeteD77

customer_reviews.title: Temperature control is really hard and tries to boil and ...
customer_reviews.text: Temperature control is really hard and tries to boil and then it stops and it just doesn't seem to regulate well at all!
customer_reviews.author: Joyboy

customer_reviews.title: NO OFF SWITCH?
customer_reviews.text: Really? How hard is it to just include an on/off switch? Plug it in and it is on. It goes from warm to boil amazingly fast which warrants 5 stars, but there is no way to turn the unit completely off without unplugging it which is kind of a pain.
customer_reviews.author: CatmomMarcia

customer_reviews.title: Very nice - but the lid is a bit tricky
customer_reviews.text: So, the lid isn't attached with a hinge, and it can be tricky to get off and on while the pot is warm. But, once it's cool, it can be pulled off and the pot cleans easily. Heats very fast and has good temperature setting options.
customer_reviews.author: Abbie Joy

customer_reviews.title: Not the best design but it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this unit to replace an older, similar model. We use it everyday. They usually last us about 2 years on average. This one heats quickly. However, I agree with previous reviews regarding how hot the handle gets if the water boils for any length of time. I also don’t like that the lid must be completely removed in order to fill or add additional water. The vent in the lid is in a bad spot. You have to be careful to avoid a steam burn. Not the best design, but it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Better than those pretty glass ones
customer_reviews.text: My wife drinks a lot of tea, after going through a few of those nice glass electric tea kettles we got this one. Faster than a microwave and those fancy glass ones. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little pot...
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a nice pot for work, and it does work just fine, however I have to admit I was a little disappointed in it. The cord stays attached and is quite short, so you are limited to the places you can sit it while heating it... Depending on your situation though, that might be good, I just needed more room for getting to an outlet in my office. Other than that though, it is light, it works fast and great and does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Collison

customer_reviews.title: Quick and reliable
customer_reviews.text: This hot pot has gotten used every single day for the last 7 months and continues to work flawlessly. It brings water to a boil quickly and efficiently, and has a very nice lid that is secure and prevents any splashing. This works well for coffee, ramen, jello, you name it. If you need to boil water, this is definitely the quickest route. Only issue I have is that the handle part of the lid isn't as easy to clean as the rest of it, but everything else works so well it can be easily overlooked.
customer_reviews.author: AJ F.

customer_reviews.title: Nothing fancy it just works
customer_reviews.text: A simple water boiler no bells or whistle that works great for ramen. I use this for lunch and it boils fast. Has to 2 settings boil and keep warm. A simple water boiler does the job.
customer_reviews.author: SurfRider

customer_reviews.title: No On/Off switch
customer_reviews.text: This product just didn't meet my needs. I needed to be able to turn it on and off not have to unplug it when I wasn't using it. Heats very quickly so I am sure it's great for heating food.
customer_reviews.author: rockr52

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use at the family cabin. Overall very pleased. Pros: Light weight. Boils water FAST. Lid fits well. Easy to pour, even when full. Looks like it will last for awhile (we have only used it for 2 weeks) Cons: when pouring with lid on, a small bit of steam leaks up to your hand. Low power setting is SLOW boil, not really warmer. We did not use it for anything except boiling water. Coating on the bottom heating element looks solid, and shows no sign of wear or degradation as mentioned in other reviews. Overall good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Alan K

customer_reviews.title: This thing is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I turned this on boil, and saw/heard nothing happening, so I let it sit and not even 45 seconds later the tea I had poured in there was at a rolling boil!! What a great buy for someone without easy access to a kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: MLSG

customer_reviews.title: Best little kettle
customer_reviews.text: Boils water in 90 seconds. I bought for making tea at my workplace. This little gadget is so easy to use-my coworkers enjoy using it too. I have had no issues and using it daily for the past month. The lid is a very tight fit (I assume it’s for safety of spilling boiling water on yourself) it takes a bit of effort to remove. Otherwise I’m thrilled with this little kettle and want one for my home now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only Has One Setting - Boil
customer_reviews.text: If you just need to boil stuff, then this thing is good. If you need to cook anything at a lower temperature, like soup, then this thing is bad. Even though it has a temperature control knob, it doesn't matter. Every temperature setting = boil.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Samuels

customer_reviews.title: simple
customer_reviews.text: I use it for boiling water for tea. I like it because the auto shutoff does not activate the moment the water starts to boil like most of the other similar kettles.
customer_reviews.author: jw

customer_reviews.title: Very fast little heating pot.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for years in the classroom. Water heats in less than 1 minute if it is half full, and after two years of use daily (all day! Hot chocolate making for between classes in high school), it lasts and lasts. This Christmas I gave my niece one when she moved away to college, and she is very happy with it, because her rental house microwave does not work well. A good thing for teens at college.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: It does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this little hot pot to use to travel with. We have a french press carafe (large) and wanted to have it with us when we went to the hotel. It provided us with an alternative to those little "pod" coffee pots or styrofoam cups you have to get dressed to go get. It fits well in our travel bag, it helps make super coffee for us. We also purchased some "bubba" coffee travel mugs and have the almost too perfect alternative to coffee while on the road! Bravo! The only thing is it does not have an on/off switch so you do need to remember to unplug it. We can do that.
customer_reviews.author: PVanMe

customer_reviews.title: this electric pot is fast and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son who's in a dorm room, It takes care of heating water to warming food and much more. He's very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: MEG

customer_reviews.title: I,ll give it a 5 star

customer_reviews.author: ana

customer_reviews.title: Boils fast!

Water boils quickly and it's been treating my husband good so far!
customer_reviews.author: Cylee

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this little hot pot.

My husband cleaned it with a mineral remover he uses to clean the toilet bowl and it came out GOOD AS NEW. I highly recommend this product.

customer_reviews.title: Boil, Boil, Boil only
customer_reviews.text: GREAT if u only want to boil water..fast but other reviews are correct bottom not nonstick..very hard to clean. I use only for water and pasta... And fresh green beans Wish I had bought the one with steam basket instead because I want to warm leftovers but can't
customer_reviews.author: Kaliena

customer_reviews.title: No power switch
customer_reviews.text: Working well as it is supposed to but no power switch. Have to unplug the power cord to turn it off.

customer_reviews.title: Hot tea

customer_reviews.title: Glad it was on sale
